Dear Mr. Hogue:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
Facility hired a staff in August 2020 and have not completed required in state/out of
state background checks.
INVESTIGATION:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face on December 29, 2020. In
addition to the face-to-face interview, email correspondence regarding this allegation
2

occurred with the Chief Administrator on December 17, 2020 and December 29,
2020. Chief Administrator said Staff 1 was his sister who was hired at the Lakes
Area program on August 31, 2020. Chief Administrator said he had been promoted
from a social service worker to Chief Administrator on August 10, 2020 and was
learning his role and working closely with Human Resource Director on hires at the
time Staff 1 was hired. Chief Administrator said the Human Resource Director is no
longer employed at Teaching Family Homes. Chief Administrator said at the time of
Staff 1’s hire it was his understanding that the Human Resource Director ran all the
Michigan checks and he had sent out the out-of-state clearance that had to be
completed in Missouri. Chief Administrator said he did not know that Central Office
would run all in and out of state checks for Teaching Family Homes. Chief
Administrator said it was his understanding that the Human Resource Director at the
time of Staff 1’s hire had completed all necessary background checks in order for
her to be hired.
Program Supervisor was interviewed face to face on December 29, 2020. In
addition to the face-to-face interview, email correspondence regarding this allegation
occurred on December 17, 2020 and December 29, 2020. Program Supervisor said
Staff 1 was hired to work at Lakes Area on August 31, 2020. Program Supervisor
said he had worked with Staff 1 on getting her pre-hire paperwork completed and
had given the completed CWL-1326-CCI-STAFF form to the Human Resource
Director. Program Supervisor said he had some background documents for Staff 1
including a background check from OIG, Michigan Sex Offender Registry, and a
Driver’s License Report. Program Supervisor said it was his understanding from the
Human Resource Director that Staff 1 was approved for hire which was why she was
hired and started on August 31, 2020. Program Supervisor said he maintains the
personnel records for the Lakes Area Home and has never received anything back
once he gives the CWL-1326-CCI-STAFF to the Human Resource Director.
Human Resource Coordinator provided documentation and information
regarding this allegation via email on December 29, 2020, January 5, 2021, and
January 6, 2021. Human Resource Coordinator said previously the Human
Resource Director was sending and receiving all background checks for all of the
Teaching Family Home licenses and Human Resource Coordinator was helping to
maintain the files. Human Resource Coordinator said she currently has access to
the former Human Resource Director’s emails. Human Resource Coordinator said
Staff 1’s CWL-1326-CCI-STAFF form had been sent to MDHHS-LASO-DCWL
mailbox on August 26, 2020. Human Resource Coordinator said there is no email
received back for Staff 1 from DCWL clearing her for hire. Human Resource
Coordinator said she is unaware of where the disconnect from the form Human
Resource Director and the Program Supervisor occurred and how Staff 1 was hired
without the clearance form being received. Human Resource Coordinator said she
received an annual clearance from DCWL on December 22, 2020 that indicated
Staff 1 was clear in Michigan and results were pending from Missouri.
3

Documents Reviewed:
 FFPSA Compliance – Annual Employee Review Lakes Area. This document
showed Staff 1 being cleared in Michigan and results pending in Missouri.
The annual background check for Staff 1 was completed on December 21,
2020.
 CWL-1326-CCI-STAFF form filled in and signed by Staff 1 dated August 21,
2020.
 National sex offender search for Staff 1. No results were found.
 Michigan Public sex offender registry search for Staff 1. No results were
found.
 OIG search for Staff 1. No results were found.
 Driver’s license report for Staff 1. Status for drivers license was valid, no
violations/conviction, suspensions/revocations found for Staff 1’s drivers
license.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of
human services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial
agency, or equivalent agency in the country where the
person usually resides, that the person has not been
determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child
neglect. The documentation shall be completed not more
than 30 days prior to the start of employment and every 12
months thereafter.
ANALYSIS: After interviews and review of documentation, it is determined
the facility hired Staff 1 prior to receiving clearance from the
State for Staff 1.
Consultation: It is suggested that if the future a clearance form
is sent and a timely response is not received, either reach back
out through the submission mailbox or to the assigned
consultant for assistance is obtaining results.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
